page.title: 18Monks Kirby's transport.
page.content: The Fosse Way runs down the west side of this Domesday Block.Further north the A5. crosses the Fosse Way, these are the main arterial roads for traffic going to and from the M1. and M6. Most of the families in Monks Kirby run their own car,only a few rely upon the public transport which serves the village four times a day.Just south of the block in the village of Pailton are coach companies which together provide the main transport for the school children of Brockhurst Middle school and it's three feeder first schools. Within a 30 to 45 minute drive are the railway stations of Rugby and Coventry.Close by are the airports of Coventry, Castle Donnington and Birmingham.
